name: .NET Code Review - Add-on
description: The .NET Code Review provides a detailed look at specific components of your .NET application’s source code and makes appropriate recommendations for any issues that are found, which may lead to support incidents in the future. The primary focus of the .NET Code Review is to check how well the code conforms to the recommended best practices in the areas of design, security, and performance. The .NET Code Review can be further tailored to focus on certain feature areas such as ASP.NET, MVC, ADO.NET, Windows Communication Foundation (WCF), Microsoft Azure, and other .NET developer and web technologies.
Contents:
© 2017 Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved. 

This data sheet is for informational purposes only. 

MICROSOFT MAKES NO WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, IN THIS SUMMARY

.NET Code Review

Maintain

Highly skilled Microsoft 

resources will use a 

combination of automated 

and manual inspection to 

isolate violations of 

Microsoft best practices 

in the source code.

Overview
The .NET Code Review provides a detailed look at specific components of 

your .NET application’s source code and makes appropriate 

recommendations for any issues that are found, which may lead to support 

incidents in the future. The primary focus of the .NET Code Review is to 

check how well the code conforms to the recommended best practices in 

the areas of design, security, and performance. The .NET Code Review 

can be further tailored to focus on certain feature areas such as ASP.NET, 

MVC, ADO.NET, Windows Communication Foundation (WCF), Microsoft 

Azure, and other .NET developer and web technologies. 

This service can delivered onsite or remote. Based on the scoping and 

engagement sizing the duration can be 2,4, or 5 days. 

Engagement Sizing
The .NET Code Review is sized to the complexity of your application using 

the following criteria. Note: Additional days may be needed based on 

violations found or lack of adherence to proper coding practices. 

Prerequisites

Discovery must be completed for an application before the .NET Code 

Review to determine priorities and goals for the review and obtain all 

necessary application components. Application stakeholders need to be 

available for consultation during the duration of the code review.

Recommendations to 

remediate the code to 

adhere to the best 

practices will be provided 

in a detailed report.

Tier Lines of code Duration

Tier 1 Up to 5000 2 days

Tier 2 5001 - 15000 4 days

Tier 3 15001 - 20000 5 days

Add-on Ad-hoc 1 day



For more information about Consulting and Support solutions from Microsoft, contact your 

Microsoft Services representative or visit www.microsoft.com/services

How the Service Works
The .NET Code Review starts with a discovery phase which ensures:

• Goals and priority areas for the review are established

• Application source code and components are obtained and 

validated.

• Scope and duration for the review were determined correctly.

• Next steps and timelines are outlined for the next phase.

Note: Reviews are usually scoped for a week or less, but larger 

applications are supported via multiple code review engagements.

After the discovery phase is completed, the source code will be 

reviewed for adherence to best practices related to design, security, 

and performance. When the review is completed, the Microsoft 

Engineer will meet you to review the findings, answer questions, and 

assist with determining the next steps.

Resources will be available to answer follow-up questions and assist 

with remediating the code up to 3 days after the report is delivered. 

Highlights

• Discovery of the application’s components and features to be 

included in the code review ensure a manageable amount of target 

code

• Typically focus on up to 3 application components or features 

identified during discovery for more in depth analysis

• A combination of automated and manual inspection will be done to 

isolate violations of Microsoft best practices in the source code

• Recommendations to remediate the code will be provided in a 

detailed report

Deliverables

• A detailed report with the review findings and recommendations for 

remediation 

Expert Microsoft developer 

resources provide 

additional guidance during 

remediation of the code.

Target Audience

This service is targeted at 

Development and Quality 

Assurance teams that are 

responsible for the 

development or stabilization 

phases of their product 

development lifecycle. 

Important Note: Code 

reviews focus on identifying 

code that is not compliant with 

documented best practices. A 

code review is not a substitute 

for thorough and well-

executed testing and 

debugging of an application.

http://www.microsoft.com/services
